solution_line_template: At a constant speed of {constant_speed} miles/hour, they will drive {total_distance} miles / {constant_speed} miles/hour = <<{total_distance}/{constant_speed}={driving_hours}>>{driving_hours} hours in total.

Every {hours_per_break_interval} hours they take a break, they will take {driving_hours} hours / {hours_per_break_interval} hours/break = <<{driving_hours}/{hours_per_break_interval}={num_breaks}>>{num_breaks} breaks.
Those breaks will be {num_breaks} breaks x {break_duration_minutes} minutes/break = <<{num_breaks}*{break_duration_minutes}={total_break_minutes}>>{total_break_minutes} minutes in total.
In hours, the breaks will be in total {total_break_minutes} minutes / {minutes_per_hour} minutes/hour = <<{total_break_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_break_hours}>>{total_break_hours} hours
To find the hotel it took them {hotel_search_minutes} minutes / {minutes_per_hour} minutes/hour = <<{hotel_search_minutes}/{minutes_per_hour}={hotel_search_hours}>>{hotel_search_hours} hours

In total, it will take {driving_hours} hours + {total_break_hours} hours + {hotel_search_hours} hours = <<{driving_hours}+{total_break_hours}+{hotel_search_hours}={total_trip_hours}>>{total_trip_hours} hours to complete the trip.
